item.title: Word of the Day: memorandum
item.description: This word has appeared in 279 articles on NYTimes.com in the past year. Can you use it in a sentence?
item.dc:creator: The Learning Network

item.title: Al matar a Renee Good, ICE nos envía un mensaje a todos
item.description: En Estados Unidos, ciudadanos e inmigrantes por igual, estamos siendo gobernados por personas que piensan que la vida es un privilegio otorgado por la autoridad, y que la muerte es una pena justa por la desobediencia.
item.dc:creator: Michelle Goldberg

item.title: Quote of the Day: Fatal Shooting by ICE Is Latest Blow to Minnesota
item.description: Quotation of the Day for Friday, January 9, 2026

item.title: Corrections: Jan. 9, 2026
item.description: Corrections that appeared in print on Friday, Jan. 9, 2026.

item.title: Inside Myanmar’s Gilded Capital, Empty Streets and Moldy Corners
item.description: Myanmar’s junta created a capital to withstand an invasion. Now, the military struggles to project an image of control over a crumbling nation.
item.dc:creator: Hannah Beech and Daniel Berehulak

media:content.media:description: An empty road in front of decommissioned tanks at the Defense Services Museum complex in Naypyidaw, Myanmar, the day after a vote in December.

item.title: She Planned Hundreds of Weddings. Now Her Own.
item.description: A pandemic-era first date, a brief separation, and a time of grief led Reneille-Gian Paneda Velez and Brian Michael Teodoro to a winter wedding in Seattle.
item.dc:creator: Donna Kim

item.title: From Bandmates to Soul Mates
item.description: Joshua Sudman and Julian Wright met in college, formed a band and wrestled for years with feelings they couldn’t quite confront.
item.dc:creator: Valeriya Safronova

item.title: She Was 40. I Was 20. Could We Make It Work?
item.description: Strangers stared when we held hands in public. Some assumed I was her adopted son.
item.dc:creator: David Woo

item.title: She Remembered ‘That Kid Who Used to Be in Love’ With Her
item.description: On Christmas Eve, Colleen DeCourcy and Jason MacDonald finished what began four decades ago during a production of “Guys and Dolls.”
item.dc:creator: Shivani Vora

item.title: Nicolai Tangen Manages Trillions of Dollars, but His Podcast Made Him Famous
item.description: Nicolai Tangen wanted to raise the profile of Norway’s $2.1 trillion oil fund and change corporate behavior, but he may have helped embroil it in a geopolitical tangle.
item.dc:creator: Ravi Mattu

media:content.media:credit: David B. Torch for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Nicolai Tangen is the chief executive of Norges Bank Investment Management, which manages Norway’s sovereign wealth fund.

item.description: During an interview with The New York Times, President Gustavo Petro of Colombia said he would speak his mind at his planned visit at the White House.

media:content.media:credit: Nathalia Angarita for The New York Times

item.title: N.Y.P.D. Fatally Shoots Blade-Wielding Man in Hospital, Officials Say
item.description: The man had cut and then barricaded himself in a blood-spattered room with a patient and a security guard at NewYork-Presbyterian Brooklyn Methodist Hospital, the police said.
item.dc:creator: Ed Shanahan and Tim Balk

media:content.media:credit: Anna Watts for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: The police responded to 911 calls about a man with a knife inside Methodist Hospital in Park Slope, Brooklyn.

item.title: Russia Appears to Use Nuclear-Capable Missile in Ukraine
item.description: If confirmed, the use of the missile would be an ominous threat to Ukraine and its Western allies.
item.dc:creator: Andrew E. Kramer

media:content.media:description: A Ukrainian soldier firing a howitzer toward the front lines of Pokrovsk, Ukraine, last month.

item.title: ‘The Pitt’ Season 2 Premiere Recap: The Doctors Will See You Now
item.description: Doctor Robby is back for one final shift before he goes on sabbatical. What could possibly go wrong?
item.dc:creator: Sean T. Collins

media:content.media:description: Season 2 of “The Pitt” opened by showing viewers a side of Dr. Robby (Noah Wyle) they hadn’t seen before.

item.title: NYT Crossword Answers for Jan. 9, 2026
item.description: Greg Snitkin and Glenn Davis supply a spirited collaboration.
item.dc:creator: Will Shortz

media:content.media:description: We hope these hints help make your solve a runaway success.

item.title: 5 Democratic States Sue Trump Administration Over $10 Billion Funding Freeze
item.description: The administration cited without evidence “potential” widespread fraud in its move to cut off funds for child care subsidies and other support for low-income families.
item.dc:creator: Minho Kim

media:content.media:credit: Michael A. McCoy for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: The Department of Health and Human Services had announced this week it was freezing funds for California, Colorado, Illinois, Minnesota and New York.

item.title: Venezuela Mourns the Dozens Who Died in U.S. Operation
item.description: For all Venezuelans, the nighttime raid opened a period of deep uncertainty. For the families of those killed, it meant the grim task of burying their relatives.
item.dc:creator: Emma Bubola
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces

media:content.media:description: Friends and family at the burial of Rosa Elena González, 80, who was killed during the U.S. raid to capture Venezuela’s president, Nicolás Maduro.

item.title: Amid Protests, ICE Told Agents to Take ‘Decisive Action’ if Threatened
item.description: The guidance comes as immigration officers have been met with increasingly hostile protesters in cities.
item.dc:creator: Hamed Aleaziz

media:content.media:description: Federal officers clashed with protesters, some of whom threw snowballs, in Minneapolis on Wednesday.

item.title: Once Again, a Newfoundland Town Rescues Stranded Passengers
item.description: After 9/11, Gander took in thousands of people whose flights were diverted. History repeated on a smaller scale this week.
item.dc:creator: Rylee Kirk

media:content.media:credit: Ian Willms for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: The airport in Gander, Newfoundland, where three flights were diverted this week for bad weather, stranding travelers.

item.title: ‘Bug’ Review: Carrie Coon Is Superb in an American Gothic Tale
item.description: Tracy Letts’s eerily topical, decades-old play about a woman’s descent into a world of conspiracy theories makes its nerve-rattling Broadway debut.
item.dc:creator: Jason Zinoman

media:content.media:description: Carrie Coon and Namir Smallwood in Tracy Letts’s stylistically slippery “Bug” at the Samuel J. Friedman Theater in Manhattan.

item.title: Trump Feels ‘Strongly’ That Russia Would Not Invade Ukraine Again
item.description: The president told The Times that he felt “strongly” that Russia would not invade Ukraine again.
item.dc:creator: Anton Troianovski

media:content.media:description: Ukraine’s 148th Artillery Brigade firing toward Russian targets in eastern Ukraine in October.

item.title: Brain Health Challenge: Doctor Appointments for Your Mind and Body
item.description: When was the last time you checked your blood pressure? Today, use a checklist to stay healthy in body and mind.
item.dc:creator: Dana G. Smith

item.title: La propaganda rusa aumenta tras la incursión de EE. UU. en Venezuela
item.description: Una red de sitios web conocida como “Portal Kombat” está difundiendo mensajes sobre material militar estadounidense, según empresas de rastreo.
item.dc:creator: Julian E. Barnes

media:content.media:description: Plaza Roja de Moscú. Rusia y Venezuela han mantenido una estrecha relación diplomática, y Moscú desea mantener esos lazos.

item.title: Rocío San Miguel fue una de las presas políticas liberadas en Venezuela
item.description: Una de las expertas en seguridad más conocidas de Venezuela fue puesta en libertad el jueves después de casi dos años de estar bajo custodia.
item.dc:creator: Anushka Patil

media:content.media:credit: Oscar Del Pozo/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images
media:content.media:description: Manifestantes exigían la liberación de Rocío San Miguel, una de las presas políticas más destacadas de Venezuela, en una concentración celebrada en Madrid, el año pasado.

item.title: Families of Slain Idaho Students Sue the University the Killer Attended
item.description: A new lawsuit claims that Washington State University, where Bryan Kohberger was a Ph.D. student, failed to take decisive action on earlier complaints that he was stalking women.
item.dc:creator: Pooja Salhotra

media:content.media:credit: Rajah Bose for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: A memorial at the University of Idaho campus in 2022.

item.title: Scientists Discover Cloud-9, a Starless ‘Galaxy That Wasn’t’
item.description: Astronomers announced the discovery of a starless cloud of hydrogen gas, a pristine relic of the cosmos that is almost as old as time itself.
item.dc:creator: Katrina Miller

media:content.media:credit: NASA, ESA, VLA, Gagandeep Anand (STScI), Alejandro Benitez-Llambay (University of Milano-Bicocca)
media:content.media:description: Cloud-9, 14 million light-years from Earth, with radio data collected from the Very Large Array in New Mexico revealing the cloud in magenta. The circle marks the peak of radio emissions, where researchers focused their search for stars.

item.title: La Marina de EE. UU. va a la caza de petroleros en el Atlántico
item.description: Una salida masiva de buques sancionados, algunos de los cuales han cambiado a banderas rusas, ha desencadenado un nuevo esfuerzo de EE. UU. por perseguir cargamentos de petróleo venezolano en el mar.
item.dc:creator: Christiaan Triebert, Riley Mellen and Eric Schmitt
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces

media:content.media:description: Imagen de un video difundido por el ejército estadounidense que supuestamente muestra el apresamiento del petrolero M Sophia en el Caribe el miércoles.

item.title: Amid Opening Sprint, Mamdani Paused to Socialize With Steven Spielberg
item.description: Zohran Mamdani, the new mayor of New York, made a private visit to the billionaire film director’s Central Park West apartment this week.
item.dc:creator: Katherine Rosman and Nicholas Fandos

media:content.media:credit: Monica Schipper/Getty Images; José A. Alvarado Jr. for The New York Times

item.title: Trump Orders Fannie and Freddie to Buy $200 Billion in Mortgage Bonds
item.description: The move, a bid to make homes more affordable, would be a back-to-future moment for the two mortgage firms. Buying risky mortgage bonds helped push them to near-bankruptcy in 2008.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Goldstein and Joe Rennison
item.category: Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corp (Freddie Mac)

media:content.media:description: President Trump has raised a number of ideas to lower housing costs, part of an effort by the White House to show it is responding to the public’s concerns about the affordability of housing.

item.title: Renee Good’s Time at Old Dominion Included an Award-Winning Poem
item.description: “What I saw in her work was a writer that was trying to illuminate the lives of others,” a faculty member recalled.
item.dc:creator: Jazmine Ulloa

media:content.media:description: A vigil was held on Wednesday night at the location on Portland Avenue in Minneapolis where Renee Nicole Good was shot and killed by a federal agent.

item.title: U.S. Border Patrol Agents Shoot 2 in Portland During Traffic Stop
item.description: The shooting came as Minneapolis grappled with a federal agent’s killing of a woman a day earlier, prompting calls from local leaders for an end to the Trump administration’s immigration crackdown.
item.dc:creator: Anna Griffin, Hamed Aleaziz and Thomas Fuller

media:content.media:credit: Jordan Gale for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Police officers blocked off an area near where victims of a shooting involving federal agents were found in Portland, Ore., on Thursday.

item.title: Trump Sees AI’s Economic Promise, While Dismissing Potential Threats
item.description: The president said that artificial intelligence would create such an abundance of jobs that robots would be required to fill the gaps.
item.dc:creator: Karoun Demirjian

media:content.media:credit: Ivan Pierre Aguirre for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: The construction site for Project Jupiter, a proposed A.I. data center planned by OpenAI and Oracle, in Santa Teresa, N.M.

item.title: ‘People We Meet on Vacation’ Review: When Stuffy Met Silly
item.description: Love grows between a restless travel writer and a contented homebody in this occasionally cute, instantly forgettable romantic comedy.
item.dc:creator: Jeannette Catsoulis

item.title: Men Cut Hole in Bathroom Wall to Steal Over $500,000 in Jewelry
item.description: Three men targeted a jewelry store in Cape Coral, Fla., according to a federal criminal complaint against the man accused of being the getaway driver. Two others have yet to be identified.
item.dc:creator: Mark Walker

item.title: Ukraine Awards Major Lithium Project to Investors With Links to Trump
item.description: Ronald S. Lauder, a billionaire friend of Mr. Trump, is among the investors. The move comes as the Trump administration looks for investment opportunities in Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: Constant Méheut

media:content.media:credit: Karsten Moran for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Ronald S. Lauder is one of the investors who won the bid to mine lithium deposits in Ukraine. He has known President Trump since college.

item.title: Senate Agrees to Display a Jan. 6 Plaque Honoring Officers
item.description: Federal law mandated that the memorial tablet be installed by March 2023, but Congress blew past that deadline.
item.dc:creator: Megan Mineiro

media:content.media:credit: Kenny Holston for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: A plaque honoring law enforcement officers who responded to the Jan. 6, 2021, attack on the Capitol is set to hang in the Senate wing after a bipartisan resolution was unanimously adopted.

item.title: Flu Cases Fall in New York City After Reaching Highest Level in a Decade
item.description: Preliminary data suggests that bouts of the viral illness have already peaked, but the city’s health commissioner urged caution.
item.dc:creator: Joseph Goldstein

media:content.media:description: While this year’s flu variant has proved capable of evading immunity, the flu shot still provides protection.

item.title: Minnesota Man Is Freed After Serving 25 Years for Murder He Did Not Commit
item.description: The state’s conviction review unit concluded that Brian Pippitt, 63, was not involved in the 1998 murder of an 84-year-old woman, for which he was serving a life sentence.
item.dc:creator: Adeel Hassan

media:content.media:description: The conviction review unit of the Minnesota Attorney General’s Office found in 2024 that Brian Pippitt was not involved in the murder for which he was sentenced to life in prison in 2001.

item.title: Trump Backs RFK Jr.’s Moves on New Childhood Vaccine Schedule
item.description: In an interview with The New York Times, the president said that Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. had not gone too far in his recommendations.
item.dc:creator: Christina Jewett

media:content.media:description: The number of child vaccinations recommended by the government has declined.

item.title: U.S. Navy Is Chasing Several Oil Tankers in the Atlantic
item.description: A mass departure by sanctioned tankers, some switching to Russian flags, has triggered a fresh effort by the United States to pursue Venezuelan oil shipments at sea.
item.dc:creator: Christiaan Triebert, Riley Mellen and Eric Schmitt
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces

media:content.media:description: An image from video released by the U.S. military purporting to show the seizure of the oil tanker M Sophia in the Caribbean on Wednesday.

item.title: Trump expone una visión del poder limitada solo por ‘mi propia moralidad’
item.description: Tema tras tema, el presidente Donald Trump dejó claro que él sería el árbitro de cualquier límite a sus autoridades, no el derecho internacional ni los tratados.
item.dc:creator: David E. Sanger, Tyler Pager, Katie Rogers and Zolan Kanno-Youngs

item.title: Trump Said His Global Power Was Limited Only by His ‘Own Morality’
item.description: Also, meet one of the front-runners to become Apple’s next C.E.O. Here’s the latest at the end of Thursday.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Cullen

item.title: Rocío San Miguel, Venezuelan Political Prisoner, Was Among Those Released
item.description: Ms. San Miguel’s arrest in 2024 raised fears that Venezuela had entered a new era of repression.
item.dc:creator: Anushka Patil

media:content.media:credit: Oscar Del Pozo/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images
media:content.media:description: Demonstrators demanding the release of Rocío San Miguel, one of Venezuela’s most prominent political prisoners, at a rally held in Madrid, last year.

item.title: Bondi Warns Minnesota Protesters to Stay Away From Federal Agents
item.description: Trump administration officials also spent the day attacking the woman killed by an ICE agent.
item.dc:creator: Zach Montague, Devlin Barrett and Ashley Ahn

media:content.media:description: Vice President Vance during a news briefing at the White House on Thursday.

item.title: I’m the Mayor of Minneapolis. Trump Is Lying to You.
item.description: This administration is making cities less safe.
item.dc:creator: Jacob Frey

item.title: The Next Phase of Trump’s Renovations: A New ‘Upper West Wing’
item.description: Besides changes to the White House, President Trump also said he planned to tear up the brick walkways in Lafayette Park and replace them with granite.
item.dc:creator: Katie Rogers, Luke Broadwater, Zolan Kanno-Youngs and Tyler Pager

media:content.media:description: In President Trump’s vision, a second level with office space would be built on top of the colonnade that connects the West Wing to the White House residence.

item.title: John Wilson’s Enduring Art of Racial Politics and Personal Memory
item.description: “Witnessing Humanity” at the Met, with more than 100 artworks, and a gaze both inward and outward, is the artist’s first New York survey.
item.dc:creator: Holland Cotter

item.title: House Passes Doomed Bill to Restore ACA Subsidies
item.description: The passage of the bill was a triumph for Democrats, who drew substantial Republican backing. But it has no path forward, and an election-year compromise is a long shot.
item.dc:creator: Michael Gold and Carl Hulse

media:content.media:credit: Morgan Lieberman for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Millions of Americans have relied on subsidies, which were expanded during the coronavirus pandemic, to help them afford coverage on federal health care exchanges.

item.title: Amos Poe, New York’s No Wave Film Pioneer, Dies at 76
item.description: He documented the punk and post-punk music scene in the East Village, leading an independent film movement that was proudly unprofessional.
item.dc:creator: Penelope Green

item.title: Trump Says ‘It’s Up To’ Xi Jinping What China Does In Taiwan
item.description: President Trump said that his actions in Venezuela did not set a precedent for other countries like Russia and China because he claimed he was responding to a “real threat.”
